page.title: 20SOCIAL ATTITUDES
page.content: Most of the villagers surveyed{liked living in{Defford.}They gave reasons such as its{pleasant location, nice {views, friendly atmosphere and peace {and quiet.}Few found anything to {dislike}but the{lack of public {transport, smells and mess from the {local farms}and{lack of children's {amenities}were mentioned by a significant number. Most respondents could rember{little {of significance happening in the {village over the last five years except for the{annnual flower {festivals and fetes.} { Local clubs and societies}included the{Gardening Club, Women's Institute, {Women's Club, Fete Committee, Village {Hall Committee, Parochial Parish {Council and the Brownies.} D.M.R.
